intro: Quamoclit denticulata, commonly known as the toothed bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, giving it the common name. Quamoclit denticulata typically grows in wetland habitats and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds.
